title: New York Life’s Pitch to Entrepreneurs: Sell Life Insurance
sub_head: Company’s CEO says its pivot to ‘cultural markets’ in the U.S., rather than overseas expansion, boosted sales and agent recruitment
body:
A career in sales is a hard sell right now, and building a diverse sales force is even tougher, recruiters say.
The 176-year-old New York Life Insurance Co. has one of the nation’s biggest fleets of life-insurance agents, totaling about 13,000, and the company has long been committed to keeping its sales force diverse.
